alert.note: Alert for Creek; Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 26 at 10:43PM CST until February 26 at 11:15PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CST FOR SOUTHWESTERN ROGERS...EAST CENTRAL CREEK...WAGONER...OKMULGEE... NORTHERN MUSKOGEE...SOUTHEASTERN TULSA AND NORTHEASTERN OKFUSKEE COUNTIES... At 1043 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles southeast of Broken Arrow, moving northeast at 105 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Muskogee... Okmulgee... Wagoner... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Coweta... Catoosa... Haskell... Inola... Kiefer... Morris... Beggs... Mounds... Kellyville... Okay... Porter... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 211 and 212, between mile markers 223 and 230, and between mile markers 233 and 243. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
